channel.title: iPhone 3G, $199
channel.description:
[IMG]http://www.blogsmithmedia.com/www.engadget.com/media/2008/06/wwdc-keynote_190.jpg[/img]
It's been a long, leak-filled wait, but Apple finally took the wraps off its 3G iPhone. Thinner edges, full plastic back, flush headphone jack, and the iPhone 2.0 firmware -- Apple's taking a lot of the criticisms to heart from the first time around. Obviously 3G is at the forefront, but they're also making sure it's available all over internationally, works with enterprises, runs 3rd party apps... and does it all for cheaper. Apple claims its 3G speeds trounce the competition, with pageloads 36% faster than the N95 and Treo 750 -- and of course it completely trounces the old EDGE data. Battery life isn't getting put out to pasture though, with 300 hours of standby, 8-10 hours of 2G talk, 5 hours of 3G talk, 7 hours of video and 24 hours of audio. GPS is also a go. Apple is using A-GPS, which supplements regular satellite GPS data with info from cellular towers. WiFi data is also worked into the mix, which should give users a pretty solid lock on where the heck they are on this planet. Apple hopes to launch in 70 countries this year. 8GB is available for $199, 16GB for $299 -- and the 16GB comes in white. Apple will be hitting the 22 biggest markets, including the US, on July 11th.
[IMG]http://www.blogsmithmedia.com/www.engadget.com/media/2008/06/wwdc-keynote_174.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://www.blogsmithmedia.com/www.engadget.com/media/2008/06/wwdc-keynote_173.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://www.blogsmithmedia.com/www.engadget.com/media/2008/06/wwdc-keynote_176.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://www.blogsmithmedia.com/www.engadget.com/media/2008/06/wwdc-keynote_180.jpg[/img] Source: http://www.engadget.com/2008/06/09/iphone-3g-is-finally-official/

item.title: iPhone 3G, $199
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

[quote=“Kane., post:10, topic:211290”][quote author=FastBawlz link=topic=278334.msg2267342#msg2267342 date=1213062619]
O yes, here are the countries getting it on July 11th:

I might actually consider buying myself one of these. How much is monthly cost etc etc??

And how do you pay for that?

You’ll know on July 11th :\

@Kane: Its $199 with a 2 year contract
[/quote]
Just read that.

“On AT&T unlimited iPhone 3G data plans for consumers will be available for $30 a month, on top of voice plans starting at $39.99 a month. Unlimited 3G data for business users will be $45 a month, on top of voice. There’s a minimum two-year agreement, but we’re not positive what that’ll look like for those currently enslaved to an AT&T contract – you could be looking at a solid four years of time if you just took the plunge.”

So basically it’s a lot more than $200, ha.[/quote]

Yes, but it’s a lot cheaper than the first iPhone which was $600 with a 2 year contract

Read full topic
